TestParameters.cmdLn: cpptestcli -compiler gcc_10-64 -config builtin://MISRA C 2023 (MISRA C 2012) -report c:\elbit-demo\embedded code\reports -module . -trace make clean all

Category.desc: MISRA C 2023 (MISRA C 2012)
Category.name: MISRAC2012

Category.desc: Rule 11.3 (Required) A conversion shall not be performed between a pointer to object type and a pointer to a different object type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_3

Category.desc: Rule 8.5 (Required) An external object or function shall be declared once in one and only one file
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_5

Category.desc: Rule 11.4 (Advisory) A conversion should not be performed between a pointer to object and an integer type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_4

Category.desc: Rule 8.6 (Required) An identifier with external linkage shall have exactly one external definition
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_6

Category.desc: Rule 11.5 (Advisory) A conversion should not be performed from pointer to void into pointer to object
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_5

Category.desc: Rule 8.3 (Required) All declarations of an object or function shall use the same names and type qualifiers
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_3

Category.desc: Rule 11.6 (Required) A cast shall not be performed between pointer to void and an arithmetic type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_6

Category.desc: Rule 8.4 (Required) A compatible declaration shall be visible when an object or function with external linkage is defined
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_4

Category.desc: Rule 11.7 (Required) A cast shall not be performed between pointer to object and a non-integer arithmetic type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_7

Category.desc: Rule 8.9 (Advisory) An object should be declared at block scope if its identifier only appears in a single function
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_9

Category.desc: Rule 11.8 (Required) A conversion shall not remove any const, volatile or _Atomic qualification from the type pointed to by a pointer
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_8

Category.desc: Rule 11.9 (Required) The macro NULL shall be the only permitted form of integer null pointer constant
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_9

Category.desc: Rule 19.1 (Mandatory) An object shall not be assigned or copied to an overlapping object
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_19_1

Category.desc: Rule 8.7 (Advisory) Functions and objects should not be defined with external linkage if they are referenced in only one translation unit
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_7

Category.desc: Dir 4.15 (Required) Evaluation of floating-point expressions shall not lead to the undetected generation of infinities and NaNs
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_15

Category.desc: Rule 19.2 (Advisory) The union keyword should not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_19_2

Category.desc: Rule 8.8 (Required) The static storage class specifier shall be used in all declarations of objects and functions that have internal linkage
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_8

Category.desc: Dir 4.14 (Required) The validity of values received from external sources shall be checked
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_14

Category.desc: Dir 4.13 (Advisory) Functions which are designed to provide operations on a resource should be called in an appropriate sequence
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_13

Category.desc: Dir 4.12 (Required) Dynamic memory allocation shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_12

Category.desc: Dir 4.11 (Required) The validity of values passed to library functions shall be checked
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_11

Category.desc: Dir 4.10 (Required) Precautions shall be taken in order to prevent the contents of a header file being included more than once
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_10

Category.desc: Dir 5.3 (Required) There shall be no dynamic thread creation
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_5_3

Category.desc: Dir 5.2 (Required) There shall be no deadlocks between threads
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_5_2

Category.desc: Dir 5.1 (Required) There shall be no data races between threads
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_5_1

Category.desc: Rule 11.10 (Required) The _Atomic qualifier shall not be applied to the incomplete type void
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_10

Category.desc: Rule 8.1 (Required) Types shall be explicitly specified
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_1

Category.desc: Rule 8.2 (Required) Function types shall be in prototype form with named parameters
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_2

Category.desc: Rule 11.1 (Required) Conversions shall not be performed between a pointer to a function and any other type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_1

Category.desc: Rule 11.2 (Required) Conversions shall not be performed between a pointer to an incomplete type and any other type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_11_2

Category.desc: Rule 22.3 (Required) The same file shall not be open for read and write access at the same time on different streams
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_3

Category.desc: Rule 22.4 (Mandatory) There shall be no attempt to write to a stream which has been opened as read-only
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_4

Category.desc: Rule 22.5 (Mandatory) A pointer to a FILE object shall not be dereferenced
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_5

Category.desc: Rule 22.6 (Mandatory) The value of a pointer to a FILE shall not be used after the associated stream has been closed
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_6

Category.desc: Rule 22.7 (Required) The macro EOF shall only be compared with the unmodified return value from any Standard Library function capable of returning EOF
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_7

Category.desc: Rule 22.8 (Required) The value of errno shall be set to zero prior to a call to an errno-setting-function
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_8

Category.desc: Rule 22.9 (Required) The value of errno shall be tested against zero after calling an errno-setting-function
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_9

Category.desc: Rule 22.1 (Required) All resources obtained dynamically by means of Standard Library functions shall be explicitly released
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_1

Category.desc: Rule 22.2 (Mandatory) A block of memory shall only be freed if it was allocated by means of a Standard Library function
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_2

Category.desc: Rule 10.4 (Required) Both operands of an operator in which the usual arithmetic conversions are performed shall have the same essential type category
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_10_4

Category.desc: Rule 7.6 (Required) The small integer variants of the minimum-width integer constant macros shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_7_6

Category.desc: Rule 10.5 (Advisory) The value of an expression should not be cast to an inappropriate essential type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_10_5

Category.desc: Rule 10.6 (Required) The value of a composite expression shall not be assigned to an object with wider essential type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_10_6

Category.desc: Rule 7.4 (Required) A string literal shall not be assigned to an object unless the object's type is "pointer to const-qualified char"
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_7_4

Category.desc: Rule 10.7 (Required) If a composite expression is used as one operand of an operator in which the usual arithmetic conversions are performed then the other operand shall not have wider essential type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_10_7

Category.desc: Rule 7.5 (Mandatory) The argument of an integer constant macro shall have an appropriate form
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_7_5

Category.desc: Rule 10.8 (Required) The value of a composite expression shall not be cast to a different essential type category or a wider essential type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_10_8

Category.desc: Rule 18.1 (Required) A pointer resulting from arithmetic on a pointer operand shall address an element of the same array as that pointer operand
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_1

Category.desc: Rule 18.2 (Required) Subtraction between pointers shall only be applied to pointers that address elements of the same array
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_2

Category.desc: Rule 18.3 (Required) The relational operators >, >=, < and <= shall not be applied to expressions of pointer type except where they point into the same object
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_3

Category.desc: Rule 18.4 (Advisory) The +, -, += and -= operators should not be applied to an expression of pointer type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_4

Category.desc: Rule 18.5 (Advisory) Declarations should contain no more than two levels of pointer nesting
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_5

Category.desc: Rule 18.6 (Required) The address of an object with automatic or thread-local storage shall not be copied to another object that persists after the first object has ceased to exist
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_6

Category.desc: Rule 18.7 (Required) Flexible array members shall not be declared
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_7

Category.desc: Rule 18.8 (Required) Variable-length arrays shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_8

Category.desc: Rule 18.9 (Required) An object with temporary lifetime shall not undergo array-to-pointer conversion
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_9

Category.desc: Rule 7.2 (Required) A "u" or "U" suffix shall be applied to all integer constants that are represented in an unsigned type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_7_2

Category.desc: Rule 10.1 (Required) Operands shall not be of an inappropriate essential type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_10_1

Category.desc: Rule 7.3 (Required) The lowercase character "l" shall not be used in a literal suffix
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_7_3

Category.desc: Rule 10.2 (Required) Expressions of essentially character type shall not be used inappropriately in addition and subtraction operations
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_10_2

Category.desc: Rule 10.3 (Required) The value of an expression shall not be assigned to an object with a narrower essential type or of a different essential type category
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_10_3

Category.desc: Rule 7.1 (Required) Octal constants shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_7_1

Category.desc: Rule 21.4 (Required) The standard header file <setjmp.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_4

Category.desc: Rule 21.5 (Required) The standard header file <signal.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_5

Category.desc: Rule 21.6 (Required) The Standard Library input/output functions shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_6

Category.desc: Rule 21.7 (Required) The Standard Library functions atof, atoi, atol and atoll of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_7

Category.desc: Rule 21.8 (Required) The Standard Library termination functions of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_8

Category.desc: Rule 21.9 (Required) The Standard Library functions bsearch and qsort of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_9

Category.desc: Rule 21.1 (Required) #define and #undef shall not be used on a reserved identifier or reserved macro name
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_1

Category.desc: Rule 21.2 (Required) A reserved identifier or macro name shall not be declared
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_2

Category.desc: Rule 21.3 (Required) The memory allocation and deallocation functions of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_3

Category.desc: Rule 13.1 (Required) Initializer lists shall not contain persistent side effects
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_13_1

Category.desc: Rule 21.25 (Required) All memory synchronization operations shall be executed in sequentially consistent order
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_25

Category.desc: Rule 13.2 (Required) The value of an expression and its persistent side effects shall be the same under all permitted evaluation orders and shall be independent from thread interleaving
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_13_2

Category.desc: Rule 21.24 (Required) The random number generator functions of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_24

Category.desc: Rule 13.3 (Advisory) A full expression containing an increment (++) or decrement (--) operator should have no other potential side effects other than that caused by the increment or decrement operator
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_13_3

Category.desc: Rule 21.23 (Required) All operand arguments to any multi-argument type-generic macros declared in <tgmath.h> shall have the same standard type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_23

Category.desc: Rule 13.4 (Advisory) The result of an assignment operator should not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_13_4

Category.desc: Rule 21.22 (Mandatory) All operand arguments to any type-generic macros declared in <tgmath.h> shall have an appropriate essential type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_22

Category.desc: Rule 13.5 (Required) The right hand operand of a logical && or || operator shall not contain persistent side effects
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_13_5

Category.desc: Rule 21.21 (Required) The Standard Library function system of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_21

Category.desc: Rule 13.6 (Required) The operand of the sizeof operator shall not contain any expression which has potential side effects
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_13_6

Category.desc: Rule 21.20 (Mandatory) The pointer returned by the Standard Library functions asctime, ctime, gmtime, localtime, localeconv, getenv, setlocale or strerror shall not be used following a subsequent call to the same function
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_20

Category.desc: Rule 18.10 (Mandatory) Pointers to variably-modified array types shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_18_10

Category.desc: Rule 21.26 (Required) The Standard Library function mtx_timedlock() shall only be invoked on mutex objects of appropriate mutex type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_26

Category.desc: Rule 2.3 (Advisory) A project should not contain unused type declarations
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_2_3

Category.desc: Rule 2.4 (Advisory) A project should not contain unused tag declarations
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_2_4

Category.desc: Rule 2.1 (Required) A project shall not contain unreachable code
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_2_1

Category.desc: Rule 2.2 (Required) A project shall not contain dead code
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_2_2

Category.desc: Rule 2.7 (Advisory) A function should not contain unused parameters
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_2_7

Category.desc: Rule 2.8 (Advisory) A project should not contain unused object definitions
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_2_8

Category.desc: Rule 2.5 (Advisory) A project should not contain unused macro definitions
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_2_5

Category.desc: Rule 2.6 (Advisory) A function should not contain unused label declarations
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_2_6

Category.desc: Rule 12.2 (Required) The right hand operand of a shift operator shall lie in the range zero to one less than the width in bits of the essential type of the left hand operand
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_12_2

Category.desc: Rule 22.15 (Required) Thread synchronization objects and thread-specific storage pointers shall not be destroyed until after all threads accessing them have terminated
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_15

Category.desc: Rule 9.4 (Required) An element of an object shall not be initialized more than once
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_9_4

Category.desc: Rule 12.3 (Advisory) The comma operator should not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_12_3

Category.desc: Rule 22.14 (Mandatory) Thread synchronization objects shall be initialized before being accessed
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_14

Category.desc: Rule 9.5 (Required) Where designated initializers are used to initialize an array object the size of the array shall be specified explicitly
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_9_5

Category.desc: Rule 12.4 (Advisory) Evaluation of constant expressions should not lead to unsigned integer wrap-around
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_12_4

Category.desc: Rule 22.13 (Required) Thread objects, thread synchronization objects and thread-specific storage pointers shall have appropriate storage duration
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_13

Category.desc: Rule 9.2 (Required) The initializer for an aggregate or union shall be enclosed in braces
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_9_2

Category.desc: Rule 12.5 (Mandatory) The sizeof operator shall not have an operand which is a function parameter declared as "array of type"
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_12_5

Category.desc: Rule 22.12 (Mandatory) Thread objects, thread synchronization objects, and thread-specific storage pointers shall only be accessed by the appropriate Standard Library functions
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_12

Category.desc: Rule 9.3 (Required) Arrays shall not be partially initialized
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_9_3

Category.desc: Rule 12.6 (Required) Structure and union members of atomic objects shall not be directly accessed
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_12_6

Category.desc: Rule 22.11 (Required) A thread that was previously either joined or detached shall not be subsequently joined nor detached
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_11

Category.desc: Rule 22.10 (Required) The value of errno shall only be tested when the last function to be called was an errno-setting-function
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_10

Category.desc: Rule 9.6 (Required) An initializer using chained designators shall not contain initializers without designators
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_9_6

Category.desc: Rule 9.7 (Mandatory) Atomic objects shall be appropriately initialized before being accessed
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_9_7

Category.desc: Dir 4.9 (Advisory) A function should be used in preference to a function-like macro where they are interchangeable
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_9

Category.desc: Dir 4.8 (Advisory) If a pointer to a structure or union is never dereferenced within a translation unit, then the implementation of the object should be hidden
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_8

Category.desc: Dir 4.5 (Advisory) Identifiers in the same name space with overlapping visibility should be typographically unambiguous
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_5

Category.desc: Rule 22.19 (Required) A condition variable shall be associated with at most one mutex object
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_19

Category.desc: Dir 4.4 (Advisory) Sections of code should not be "commented out"
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_4

Category.desc: Rule 22.18 (Required) Non-recursive mutexes shall not be recursively locked
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_18

Category.desc: Dir 4.7 (Required) If a function returns error information, then that error information shall be tested
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_7

Category.desc: Rule 22.17 (Required) No thread shall unlock a mutex or call cnd_wait() or cnd_timedwait() for a mutex it has not locked before
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_17

Category.desc: Dir 4.6 (Advisory) typedefs that indicate size and signedness should be used in place of the basic numerical types
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_6

Category.desc: Rule 22.16 (Required) All mutex objects locked by a thread shall be explicitly unlocked by the same thread
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_16

Category.desc: Dir 4.1 (Required) Run-time failures shall be minimized
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_1

Category.desc: Rule 8.12 (Required) Within an enumerator list, the value of an implicitly-specified enumeration constant shall be unique
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_12

Category.desc: Rule 8.13 (Advisory) A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_13

Category.desc: Dir 4.3 (Required) Assembly language shall be encapsulated and isolated
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_3

Category.desc: Rule 8.14 (Required) The restrict type qualifier shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_14

Category.desc: Dir 4.2 (Advisory) All usage of assembly language should be documented
Category.name: MISRAC2012-DIR_4_2

Category.desc: Rule 8.15 (Required) All declarations of an object with an explicit alignment specification shall specify the same alignment
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_15

Category.desc: Rule 1.1 (Required) The program shall contain no violations of the standard C syntax and constraints, and shall not exceed the implementation's translation limits
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_1_1

Category.desc: Rule 8.10 (Required) An inline function shall be declared with the static storage class
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_10

Category.desc: Rule 8.11 (Advisory) When an array with external linkage is declared, its size should be explicitly specified
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_11

Category.desc: Rule 1.4 (Required) Emergent language features shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_1_4

Category.desc: Rule 1.5 (Required) Obsolescent language features shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_1_5

Category.desc: Rule 1.3 (Required) There shall be no occurrence of undefined or critical unspecified behaviour
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_1_3

Category.desc: Rule 8.16 (Advisory) The alignment specification of zero should not appear in an object declaration
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_16

Category.desc: Rule 8.17 (Advisory) At most one explicit alignment specifier should appear in an object declaration
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_8_17

Category.desc: Rule 9.1 (Mandatory) The value of an object with automatic storage duration shall not be read before it has been set
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_9_1

Category.desc: Rule 12.1 (Advisory) The precedence of operators within expressions should be made explicit
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_12_1

Category.desc: Rule 17.10 (Required) A function declared with a _Noreturn function specifier shall have void return type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_10

Category.desc: Rule 23.2 (Required) A generic selection that is not expanded from a macro shall not contain potential side effects in the controlling expression
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_23_2

Category.desc: Rule 17.11 (Advisory) A function that never returns should be declared with a _Noreturn function specifier
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_11

Category.desc: Rule 23.3 (Advisory) A generic selection should contain at least one non-default association
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_23_3

Category.desc: Rule 17.12 (Advisory) A function identifier should only be used with either a preceding &, or with a parenthesized parameter list
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_12

Category.desc: Rule 23.4 (Required) A generic association shall list an appropriate type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_23_4

Category.desc: Rule 17.13 (Required) A function type shall not be type qualified
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_13

Category.desc: Rule 23.5 (Advisory) A generic selection should not depend on implicit pointer type conversion
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_23_5

Category.desc: Rule 23.6 (Required) The controlling expression of a generic selection shall have an essential type that matches its standard type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_23_6

Category.desc: Rule 23.7 (Advisory) A generic selection that is expanded from a macro should evaluate its argument only once
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_23_7

Category.desc: Rule 22.20 (Mandatory) Thread-specific storage pointers shall be created before being accessed
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_22_20

Category.desc: Rule 23.8 (Required) A default association shall appear as either the first or the last association of a generic selection
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_23_8

Category.desc: Rule 23.1 (Advisory) A generic selection should only be expanded from a macro
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_23_1

Category.desc: Rule 20.13 (Required) A line whose first token is # shall be a valid preprocessing directive
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_13

Category.desc: Rule 20.12 (Required) A macro parameter used as an operand to the # or ## operators, which is itself subject to further macro replacement, shall only be used as an operand to these operators
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_12

Category.desc: Rule 15.1 (Advisory) The goto statement should not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_15_1

Category.desc: Rule 20.11 (Required) A macro parameter immediately following a # operator shall not immediately be followed by a ## operator
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_11

Category.desc: Rule 15.2 (Required) The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_15_2

Category.desc: Rule 20.10 (Advisory) The # and ## preprocessor operators should not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_10

Category.desc: Rule 15.3 (Required) Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in any block enclosing the goto statement
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_15_3

Category.desc: Rule 15.4 (Advisory) There should be no more than one break or goto statement used to terminate any iteration statement
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_15_4

Category.desc: Rule 15.5 (Advisory) A function should have a single point of exit at the end
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_15_5

Category.desc: Rule 15.6 (Required) The body of an iteration-statement or a selection-statement shall be a compound-statement
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_15_6

Category.desc: Rule 15.7 (Required) All if ... else if constructs shall be terminated with an else statement
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_15_7

Category.desc: Rule 20.14 (Required) All #else, #elif and #endif preprocessor directives shall reside in the same file as the #if, #ifdef or #ifndef directive to which they are related
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_14

Category.desc: Rule 4.1 (Required) Octal and hexadecimal escape sequences shall be terminated
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_4_1

Category.desc: Rule 4.2 (Advisory) Trigraphs should not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_4_2

Category.desc: Rule 14.1 (Required) A loop counter shall not have essentially floating type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_14_1

Category.desc: Rule 14.2 (Required) A for loop shall be well-formed
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_14_2

Category.desc: Rule 14.3 (Required) Controlling expressions shall not be invariant
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_14_3

Category.desc: Rule 14.4 (Required) The controlling expression of an if statement and the controlling expression of an iteration-statement shall have essentially Boolean type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_14_4

Category.desc: Rule 3.2 (Required) Line-splicing shall not be used in // comments
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_3_2

Category.desc: Rule 3.1 (Required) The character sequences /* and // shall not be used within a comment
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_3_1

Category.desc: Rule 21.14 (Required) The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_14

Category.desc: Rule 21.13 (Mandatory) Any value passed to a function in <ctype.h> shall be representable as an unsigned char or be the value EOF
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_13

Category.desc: Rule 21.12 (Required) The standard header file <fenv.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_12

Category.desc: Rule 21.11 (Advisory) The standard header file <tgmath.h> should not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_11

Category.desc: Rule 21.10 (Required) The Standard Library time and date functions shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_10

Category.desc: Rule 21.19 (Mandatory) The pointers returned by the Standard Library functions localeconv, getenv, setlocale or strerror shall only be used as if they have pointer to const-qualified type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_19

Category.desc: Rule 21.18 (Mandatory) The size_t argument passed to any function in <string.h> shall have an appropriate value
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_18

Category.desc: Rule 21.17 (Mandatory) Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_17

Category.desc: Rule 21.16 (Required) The pointer arguments to the Standard Library function memcmp shall point to either a pointer type, an essentially signed type, an essentially unsigned type, an essentially Boolean type or an essentially enum type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_16

Category.desc: Rule 21.15 (Required) The pointer arguments to the Standard Library functions memcpy, memmove and memcmp shall be pointers to qualified or unqualified versions of compatible types
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_21_15

Category.desc: Rule 17.1 (Required) The standard header file <stdarg.h> shall not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_1

Category.desc: Rule 17.2 (Required) Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_2

Category.desc: Rule 17.3 (Mandatory) A function shall not be declared implicitly
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_3

Category.desc: Rule 17.4 (Mandatory) All exit paths from a function with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_4

Category.desc: Rule 17.5 (Required) The function argument corresponding to a parameter declared to have an array type shall have an appropriate number of elements
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_5

Category.desc: Rule 17.6 (Mandatory) The declaration of an array parameter shall not contain the static keyword between the [ ]
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_6

Category.desc: Rule 17.7 (Required) The value returned by a function having non-void return type shall be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_7

Category.desc: Rule 17.8 (Advisory) A function parameter should not be modified
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_8

Category.desc: Rule 17.9 (Mandatory) A function declared with a _Noreturn function specifier shall not return to its caller
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_17_9

Category.desc: Rule 6.3 (Required) A bit field shall not be declared as a member of a union
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_6_3

Category.desc: Rule 6.1 (Required) Bit-fields shall only be declared with an appropriate type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_6_1

Category.desc: Rule 6.2 (Required) Single-bit named bit fields shall not be of a signed type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_6_2

Category.desc: Rule 20.5 (Advisory) #undef should not be used
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_5

Category.desc: Rule 20.6 (Required) Tokens that look like a preprocessing directive shall not occur within a macro argument
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_6

Category.desc: Rule 20.7 (Required) Expressions resulting from the expansion of macro parameters shall be enclosed in parentheses
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_7

Category.desc: Rule 20.8 (Required) The controlling expression of a #if or #elif preprocessing directive shall evaluate to 0 or 1
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_8

Category.desc: Rule 20.9 (Required) All identifiers used in the controlling expression of #if or #elif preprocessing directives shall be #define'd before evaluation
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_9

Category.desc: Rule 20.1 (Advisory) #include directives should only be preceded by preprocessor directives or comments
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_1

Category.desc: Rule 20.2 (Required) The ', " or \ characters and the /* or // character sequences shall not occur in a header file name
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_2

Category.desc: Rule 20.3 (Required) The #include directive shall be followed by either a <filename> or "filename" sequence
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_3

Category.desc: Rule 20.4 (Required) A macro shall not be defined with the same name as a keyword
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_20_4

Category.desc: Rule 5.8 (Required) Identifiers that define objects or functions with external linkage shall be unique
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_5_8

Category.desc: Rule 5.9 (Advisory) Identifiers that define objects or functions with internal linkage should be unique
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_5_9

Category.desc: Rule 5.6 (Required) A typedef name shall be a unique identifier
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_5_6

Category.desc: Rule 16.1 (Required) All switch statements shall be well-formed
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_16_1

Category.desc: Rule 5.7 (Required) A tag name shall be a unique identifier
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_5_7

Category.desc: Rule 16.2 (Required) A switch label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_16_2

Category.desc: Rule 16.3 (Required) An unconditional break statement shall terminate every switch-clause
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_16_3

Category.desc: Rule 16.4 (Required) Every switch statement shall have a default label
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_16_4

Category.desc: Rule 16.5 (Required) A default label shall appear as either the first or the last switch label of a switch statement
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_16_5

Category.desc: Rule 16.6 (Required) Every switch statement shall have at least two switch-clauses
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_16_6

Category.desc: Rule 16.7 (Required) A switch-expression shall not have essentially Boolean type
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_16_7

Category.desc: Rule 5.1 (Required) External identifiers shall be distinct
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_5_1

Category.desc: Rule 5.4 (Required) Macro identifiers shall be distinct
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_5_4

Category.desc: Rule 5.5 (Required) Identifiers shall be distinct from macro names
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_5_5

Category.desc: Rule 5.2 (Required) Identifiers declared in the same scope and name space shall be distinct
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_5_2

Category.desc: Rule 5.3 (Required) An identifier declared in an inner scope shall not hide an identifier declared in an outer scope
Category.name: MISRAC2012-RULE_5_3

Rule.desc: Avoid accessing arrays out of bounds
Avoid null pointer dereferencing
Avoid division by zero
Avoid buffer overflow due to defining incorrect format limits
Avoid overflow due to reading a not zero terminated string
Avoid overflow when reading from a buffer
Avoid overflow when writing to a buffer
Do not subtract two pointers that do not address elements of the same array
Do not compare two unrelated pointers
Avoid wraparounds when performing arithmetic integer operations
Avoid signed integer overflows
Avoid data loss when converting between integer types
Use multiple include guards
Validate values passed to library functions
Dynamic heap memory allocation shall not be used
Ensure resources are freed
Do not use resources that have been freed
Do not free resources using invalid pointers
Do not abandon unreleased locks
Avoid double locking
Do not release a lock that has not been acquired
Avoid tainted data in array indexes
Avoid potential integer overflow/underflow on tainted data
Avoid buffer read overflow from tainted data
Avoid buffer write overflow from tainted data
Protect against command injection
Protect against file name injection
Protect against SQL injection
Prevent buffer overflows from tainted data
Avoid buffer overflow from tainted data due to defining incorrect format limits
Protect against environment injection
Avoid printing tainted data on the output console
Exclude unsanitized user input from format strings
Do not use floating-point expressions which may result in NaN and infinity values
All usage of assembler shall be documented
Assembly language shall be encapsulated and isolated
Sections of code should not be "commented out"
Sections of code should not be "commented out" using Doxygen comments
Identifiers in the same name space with overlapping visibility should be typographically unambiguous
A typedef for a standard integer type should contain the number indicating its size in its name
The names of standard signed integer types and standard unsigned integer types should not be used
Use typedefs from stdint.h instead of declaring your own in C99 code
The names of standard floating-point types should not be used
A typedef for a standard floating-point type should contain the number indicating its size in its name
Consistently check the returned value of non-void functions
Always check the returned value of non-void function
If a pointer to a structure or union is never dereferenced within a translation unit, then the implementation of the object should be hidden
A function should be used in preference to a function-like macro
Do not use global variable with different locks set
Variable should be used in context of single critical section
There shall be no data races between threads
Do not acquire locks in different order
A thread should not be created by another thread
An expression of essentially Boolean type should always be used where an operand is interpreted as a Boolean value
An operand of essentially Boolean type should not be used where an operand is interpreted as a numeric value
An operand of essentially character type should not be used where an operand is interpreted as a numeric value
An operand of essentially enum type should not be used in an arithmetic operation
Shift and bitwise operations should not be performed on operands of essentially signed or enum type
An operand of essentially signed or enum type should not be used as the right hand operand to the bitwise shifting operator
An operand of essentially unsigned type should not be used as the operand to the unary minus operator
Floating-point expressions shall not be explicitly (syntactically) tested for equality (==) or inequality (!=)
Pointers shall not be implicitly compared to NULL
Expressions of essentially character type shall not be used inappropriately in addition and subtraction operations
The value of an expression shall not be assigned to an object with a narrower essential type
The value of an expression shall not be assigned to an object of a different essential type category
Both operands of an operator in which the usual arithmetic conversions are performed shall have the same essential type category
The second and third operands of the ternary operator shall have the same essential type category
The cast operation to essentially enumeration type is not allowed
Do not cast from or to essentially Boolean type
Do not use casts between essentially character types and essentially floating types
The value of a composite expression shall not be assigned to an object with wider essential type
If a composite expression is used as one operand of an operator in which the usual arithmetic conversions are performed then the other operand shall not have wider essential type
If a composite expression is used as one (second or third) operand of a conditional operator then the other operand shall not have wider essential type
The value of a composite expression shall not be cast to a different essential type category or a wider essential type
Conversions shall not be performed between a pointer to a function and any other type than pointer to function
Conversions shall not be performed between non compatible pointer to a function types
The '_Atomic' qualifier should not be used with the 'void' type
Conversions shall not be performed between a pointer to an incomplete type and any other type
A cast shall not be performed between a pointer to object type and a pointer to a different object type
A conversion should not be performed between a pointer to object and an integer type
A conversion should not be performed from pointer to void into pointer to object
A cast shall not be performed between pointer to void and an arithmetic type
A cast shall not be performed between pointer to object and a non-integer arithmetic type
A conversion shall not remove any 'const', 'volatile' or '_Atomic' qualification from the type accessed via a pointer or by reference
Literal zero (0) shall not be used as the null-pointer-constant
Use NULL instead of literal zero (0) as the null-pointer-constant
Use parentheses to indicate the precedence of operators in expressions
The operand of the 'sizeof' operator should be enclosed in parentheses
Avoid incorrect shift operations
The right-hand operand of a shift operator shall lie between zero and one less than the width in bits of the essential or underlying type of the left-hand operand
The comma operator shall not be used
Integer overflow or underflow in constant expression in '+', '-', '*' operator
Integer overflow or underflow in constant expression in '<<' operator
The 'sizeof' operator shall not have an operand which is a function parameter declared as "array of type"
Members of atomic objects of structure and union types should not be directly accessed
Initializer lists shall not contain persistent side effects
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
Avoid code that depends on the order of evaluation of function arguments
Avoid code that depends on the order of evaluation of the function designator and function arguments
Avoid code that depends on the order of evaluation of expressions involving a function call
Between sequence points an object shall have its stored value modified at most once by the evaluation of an expression
Do not use more than one volatile between two adjacent sequence points
Avoid code that depends on the order of evaluation of function calls
The value of an expression with atomic type should be independent from thread interleaving
A full expression containing an increment (++) or decrement (--) operator should have no other potential side effects
The result of an assignment operator should not be used
The right-hand operand of a logical && or || operator shall not contain side effects
The operand of the sizeof operator shall not contain any expression which has side effects
Object designated by a volatile lvalue should not be accessed in the operand of the sizeof operator
The function call shall not be the operand of the sizeof operator
A loop counter in a 'for' loop shall not have essentially floating type
A loop counter in 'while' and 'do-while' loops shall not have essentially floating type
There shall only be one loop counter in a 'for' loop, which shall not be modified in the 'for' loop body
The first clause of a 'for' loop shall be well-formed
The second clause of a 'for' loop shall be well-formed
The third clause of a 'for' statement shall be well-formed
Avoid conditions that always evaluate to the same value
Tests of a value against zero should be made explicit, unless the operand is effectively Boolean
The goto statement shall not be used
The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function body
Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement
For any iteration statement there shall be no more than one break or goto statement used for loop termination
A function shall have a single point of exit at the end of the function
The statement forming the body of a 'switch', 'while', 'do...while' or 'for' statement shall be a compound statement
The statement forming the body of an 'if' or 'else' statement should be a compound statement
All 'if...else-if' constructs shall be terminated with an 'else' clause
A switch statement shall only contain switch labels and switch clauses, and no other code
A switch label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement
An unconditional break statement shall terminate every non-empty case clause
An unconditional break statement shall terminate every non-empty default clause
Always provide a default branch for switch statements
A 'default' label shall have a statement or a comment before terminating 'break'
A 'default' label, if it exists, shall appear as either the first or the last switch label of a switch statement
Every switch statement shall have at least two switch-clauses
A switch label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement
An unconditional break statement shall terminate every non-empty case clause
An unconditional break statement shall terminate every non-empty default clause
Always provide a default branch for switch statements
A 'default' label shall have a statement or a comment before terminating 'break'
A 'default' label, if it exists, shall appear as either the first or the last switch label of a switch statement
Every switch statement shall have at least two switch-clauses
A switch expression shall not represent a value that is effectively Boolean
A switch expression shall not represent a value that is effectively Boolean
The identifiers va_list, va_arg, va_start, va_end, va_copy should not be used
The identifiers va_list, va_arg, va_start, va_end should not be used
The standard header file <stdarg.h> or <cstdarg> shall not be used
Functions declared as 'noreturn' shall have the 'void' return type
Declare non-returning functions with the attribute that specifies that they do not return
A function identifier shall only be used with either a preceding '&', or with a parenthesised parameter list, which may be empty
Do not include any type qualifiers in the specification of a function type
Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly
Functions shall always have visible prototype at the function call
All exit paths from a function with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression
All exit paths from a function, except main(), with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression
The function argument corresponding to a parameter declared to have an array type shall have an appropriate number of elements
The declaration of an array parameter shall not contain the 'static' keyword between the [ ]
The value returned by a function having non-void return type shall be used
The value returned by a function having non-void return type shall be used
A function parameter should not be modified
Never return from functions that should not return
Avoid accessing arrays out of bounds
Avoid accessing arrays and pointers out of bounds
A pointer operand and any pointer resulting from pointer arithmetic using that operand shall both address elements of the same array
Pointers to variably-modified array types should not be used
Do not subtract two pointers that do not address elements of the same array
Do not compare two unrelated pointers
The +, -, += and -= operators should not be applied to an expression of pointer type
The declaration of objects should contain no more than 2 levels of pointer indirection
The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be returned from a function
The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be assigned to another object that may persist after the first object has ceased to exist
The address of an object with thread storage duration shall not be assigned to an object with static storage duration
Flexible array members shall not be declared
Variable-length arrays should not be used
Do not modify objects with temporary lifetime
An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object
An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object
An object shall not be assigned or copied to an overlapping object
The union keyword should not be used
A program should not exceed the translation limits imposed by The Standard (c90)
A program should not exceed the translation limits imposed by The Standard (c99)
A program should not exceed the translation limits imposed by The Standard (c90)
A program should not exceed the translation limits imposed by The Standard (c99)
Avoid division by zero
Avoid use before initialization
Do not use resources that have been freed
Avoid overflow when reading from a buffer
Avoid overflow when writing to a buffer
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
Avoid code that depends on the order of evaluation of function arguments
Avoid code that depends on the order of evaluation of the function designator and function arguments
Avoid code that depends on the order of evaluation of expressions involving a function call
Between sequence points an object shall have its stored value modified at most once by the evaluation of an expression
Do not use more than one volatile between two adjacent sequence points
Avoid code that depends on the order of evaluation of function calls
The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be returned from a function
The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be assigned to another object that may persist after the first object has ceased to exist
The left-hand operand of a right-shift operator shall not have a negative value
The '__STDC_WANT_LIB_EXT1__' macro should not be defined to the value other than '0'
The 'rsize_t' type should not be used
The 'errno_t' type should not be used
Do not use following macros: RSIZE_MAX, L_tmpnam_s, TMP_MAX_S
Do not use the functions defined in Annex K of ISO/IEC 9899:2011 standard
The static storage class specifier shall be used in definitions and declarations of objects and functions that have internal linkage
Storage type modifiers shall be associated with the type, not the variable or the function
Function types shall be in prototype form
Do not use the macro ATOMIC_VAR_INIT
Do not use the 'bool', 'false' or 'true' identifiers in the #undef directive
Do not use the ungetc function on a stream with the file position indicator zero
Do not pass 0 value as a size argument to the realloc function
#include statements in a file should only be preceded by other preprocessor directives or comments
The # and ## preprocessor operators should not be used
A macro parameter immediately following a # operator shall not immediately be followed by a ## operator
A macro parameter used as an operand to the # or ## operators, which is itself subject to further macro replacement, shall only be used as an operand to these operators
Preprocessing directives shall be syntactically meaningful even when excluded by the preprocessor
All #else, #elif and #endif preprocessor directives shall reside in the same file as the #if or #ifdef directive to which they are related
The ', ", /* or // characters shall not occur in a header file name
The \ character should not occur in a header file name
The #include directive shall be followed by either a <filename> or "filename" sequence
A macro shall not be defined with the same name as a keyword in C90
A macro shall not be defined with the same name as a keyword in C99
#undef shall not be used
Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like preprocessing directives
In the definition of a function-like macro each instance of a parameter shall be enclosed in parentheses unless it is used as the operand of # or ##
The controlling expression of a #if or #elif preprocessing directive shall evaluate to 0 or 1
Do not use in preprocessor directives #if and #elif macros not defined in translation unit
Do not #define or #undef identifiers with names which start with underscore
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library, shall not be defined, redefined or undefined (C90 code)
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library, shall not be defined, redefined or undefined (C99 code)
Do not #define nor #undef identifier 'defined'
The standard header files <time.h> or <ctime> shall not be used
The time handling functions and macros of the library <time.h> shall not be used
The types defined in the library <time.h> shall not be used
The standard header file <tgmath.h> shall not be used
The features provided by <fenv.h> should not be used
The standard header file <fenv.h> shall not be used
Do not pass incorrect values to ctype.h library functions
The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings
The pointer arguments to the Standard Library functions 'memcmp', 'memmove' and 'memcmp' shall be pointers to qualified or unqualified versions of compatible types

The pointer arguments to the Standard Library function 'memcmp' shall point to either a pointer type, an essentially signed type, an essentially unsigned type, an essentially Boolean type or an essentially enum type
Avoid overflow due to reading a not zero terminated string
Avoid overflow when writing to a buffer
The size_t argument passed to any function in string.h shall have an appropriate value
The pointers returned by the Standard Library functions 'localeconv', 'getenv', 'setlocale' or, 'strerror' shall only be used as if they have pointer to const-qualified type
Strings pointed by members of the structure 'lconv' should not be modified
The names of standard library macros, objects and functions shall not be reused
The names of standard library macros, objects and functions shall not be reused (C90)
The names of standard library macros, objects and functions shall not be reused (C99)
Pointers returned by certain Standard Library functions should not be used following a subsequent call to the same or related function
The 'system()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library should not be used

All arguments to any multi-argument type-generic macros declared in <tgmath.h> shall have the same standard type
The random number generator functions 'rand()' and 'srand()' should not be used
Only 'memory_order_seq_cst' should be used as an explicit memory order argument
The Standard Library function mtx_timedlock() shall not be invoked on a mutex that does not support timeout
Dynamic heap memory allocation shall not be used
The facilities provided by <setjmp.h> should not be used

The signal handling facilities of <signal.h> shall not be used
The input/output functions from the 'cstdio' and 'cwchar' libraries should not be used
The 'atof', 'atoi', 'atol' and 'atoll' functions from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library should not be used
The 'abort()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The 'exit()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The 'quick_exit()' and '_Exit()' functions from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The library functions bsearch and qsort of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
Ensure resources are freed
Properly use errno value
Do not join or detach a thread that was previously joined or detached
Thread objects, thread synchronization objects, and thread-specific storage pointers shall only be accessed by the appropriate Standard Library functions
Thread objects, thread synchronization objects and thread-specific storage pointers shall not have automatic storage duration
A thread synchronization object should not be initialized by a thread
The second argument passed to the 'mtx_init()' function call should be either 'mtx_plain', 'mtx_timed', 'mtx_plain | mtx_recursive', or 'mtx_timed | mtx_recursive'
A thread synchronization object should not be destroyed by a thread
Do not abandon unreleased locks
Do not release a lock that has not been acquired
Avoid double locking
Do not use more than one mutex for concurrent waiting operations on a condition variable
Do not use resources that have been freed
Do not free resources using invalid pointers
A thread-specific storage should not be created by a thread
The same file shall not be opened for read and write access at the same time on different streams
Avoid writing to a stream which has been opened as read only
A pointer to a FILE object shall not be dereferenced
A pointer to a FILE object shall not be dereferenced by a library function
Do not use resources that have been freed
The macro EOF should be compared with the unmodified return value from the Standard Library function
Properly use errno value
Properly use errno value

A generic selection that is not expanded from a macro shall not contain potential side effects in the controlling expression
A generic selection shall indicate at least one non-default association
A generic association shall list an appropriate type
A generic selection should not depend on implicit pointer type conversion

Enumerated types should not be mixed with integer types in generic selections

The default association shall be placed first or last in the association list
There shall be no unreachable code in "else" block

There shall be no unreachable code in "if/else/while/for" block
There shall be no unreachable code in switch statement
There shall be no unreachable code in 'for' loop

There shall be no unreachable code after "if" or "switch" statement inside while/for/do...while loop
Avoid unreachable methods
All non-null statements shall either have at least one side-effect however executed or cause control flow to change
Avoid unused values
A function should not contain unused type declarations
A source file should not contain unused type declarations
A function should not contain unused local tag declarations
A source file should not contain unused tag declarations
A source file should not contain unused macro definitions
A function should not contain unused label declarations
There should be no unused parameters in functions
A project should not contain unused variables with external linkage
A project should not contain unused variables with internal linkage
A project should not contain unused local variables
The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C-style comment
The character sequence // shall not be used within a C-style comment
The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C++-style comment
Line-splicing shall not be used in // comments

Identifiers declared in the file scope and in the same name space shall be distinct (c99)
Identifiers declared in the same block scope and name space shall be distinct (c90)
Identifiers declared in the same block scope and name space shall be distinct (c99)

The name of a macro should be distinct from the names of its parameters(c99)

A 'U' suffix shall be applied to all constants of unsigned type
Use capital 'L' instead of lowercase 'l' to indicate long

The small integer variants of the minimum-width integer constant macros should not be used

Whenever an object is declared or defined, its type shall be explicitly stated
An inline function shall be declared with the static storage class
When an array with external linkage is declared, its size should be explicitly specified
Within an enumerator list, the value of an implicitly-specified enumeration constant shall be unique
A pointer parameter in a function prototype should be declared as pointer to const if the pointer is not used to modify the addressed object
Declare a type of parameter as typedef to pointer to const if the pointer is not used to modify the addressed object
The restrict type qualifier shall not be used
Explicit alignment specifiers in all declarations of an object with external linkage shall be the same
Explicit alignment specifiers in all declarations of an object with internal linkage shall be the same
The zero-alignment specifier should not be used in an object declaration
A declaration of an object should contain at most one explicit alignment specifier
Identifiers shall be given for all of the parameters in a function prototype declaration
Function types shall have named parameters
Function types shall be in prototype form
If objects or functions are declared more than once their types shall be compatible
The identifiers used in the declaration and definition of a function shall be identical
All declarations of an object or function shall have compatible types
A declaration shall be visible when an object or function with external linkage is defined
If objects or functions are declared more than once their types shall be compatible
An external object or function shall not have more than one non-defining declaration in translation unit
An identifier with external linkage shall have no more then one external definition
An identifier with external linkage shall have external definition
Functions and objects should not be defined with external linkage if they are referenced in only one translation unit
The static storage class specifier shall be used in definitions and declarations of objects and functions that have internal linkage
Objects shall be defined at block scope if they are only accessed from within a single function
Avoid use before initialization
The initializer for an aggregate or union shall be enclosed in braces
Arrays shall not be partially initialized
An element of an object shall not be initialized more than once
Where designated initializers are used to initialize an array object the size of the array shall be specified explicitly
An initializer using chained designators shall not contain initializers without designators
Atomic objects shall be properly initialized before being accessed
